trans-unit.source: Determines whether an assembly belongs to a code group by testing its hash value.
This class cannot be inherited.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.HashMembershipCondition"></xref> class with the hash algorithm and hash value that determine membership.
The hash algorithm to use to compute the hash value for the assembly.
The hash value for which to test.
The hashAlg parameter is `null`.
-or-
The value parameter is `null`.
The hashAlg parameter is not a valid hash algorithm.
Determines whether the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition.
This membership condition tests only the <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash> evidence object.
There should be no more than one <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash> object in the evidence.
The evidence set against which to make the test.
`true` if the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition; otherwise, `false`.
Creates an equivalent copy of the membership condition.
A new, identical copy of the current membership condition.

Determines whether the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.HashMembershipCondition.HashValue"></xref> and the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.HashMembershipCondition.HashAlgorithm"></xref> from the specified object are equivalent to the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.HashMembershipCondition.HashValue"></xref> and <xref href="System.Security.Policy.HashMembershipCondition.HashAlgorithm"></xref> contained in the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.HashMembershipCondition"></xref>.
The object to compare to the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.HashMembershipCondition"></xref>.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.HashMembershipCondition.HashValue"></xref> and <xref href="System.Security.Policy.HashMembershipCondition.HashAlgorithm"></xref> from the specified object is equivalent to the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.HashMembershipCondition.HashValue"></xref> and <xref href="System.Security.Policy.HashMembershipCondition.HashAlgorithm"></xref> contained in the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.HashMembershipCondition"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Reconstructs a security object with a specified state from an XML encoding.
The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
Reconstructs a security object with a specified state from an XML encoding.
The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
The policy level context, used to resolve named permission set references.
The e parameter is `null`.
The e parameter is not a valid membership condition element.
Gets the hash code for the current membership condition.
The hash code for the current membership condition.
Gets or sets the hash algorithm to use for the membership condition.
The hash algorithm to use for the membership condition.
An attempt is made to set <xref href="System.Security.Policy.HashMembershipCondition.HashAlgorithm"></xref> to `null`.
Gets or sets the hash value for which the membership condition tests.
If the number of bytes in the hash value is incorrect for the current hash algorithm, the membership condition never finds a match.
The hash value for which the membership condition tests.
An attempt is made to set <xref href="System.Security.Policy.HashMembershipCondition.HashValue"></xref> to `null`.
Creates and returns a string representation of the membership condition.
A string representation of the state of the membership condition.
Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state.
An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.
Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state with the specified <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyLevel"></xref>.
The policy level context for resolving named permission set references.
An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.
Runs when the entire object graph has been deserialized.
The object that initiated the callback.
The functionality for this parameter is not currently implemented.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> with the data needed to serialize the target object.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
The destination <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> for this serialization.
